policy_name: Social Media United States Compliance Policy
description: Compliance guidelines for social media platforms (TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, Snapchat) in the United States market.

regional_notes.overview: US social media is largely self-regulated with platform-specific community guidelines. First Amendment provides broad speech protections but platforms can enforce their own rules.
regional_notes.tiktok: COPPA compliance critical. Algorithm-driven visibility makes content moderation essential. No minors in unsafe situations.
regional_notes.instagram: Visual platform with strong community guidelines on nudity, violence, and hate. Shopping integration adds commercial compliance.
regional_notes.facebook: Oversight Board decisions, news integrity policies, and extensive hate speech rules.
regional_notes.twitter_x: More permissive on speech but enforces rules against harassment, violent threats, and CSAM.

Kids (G).description: Content suitable for all ages on social media platforms
restricted: None - all content must be fully appropriate
general_requirements: COPPA compliance - no data collection from under 13
Safe messaging - no DMs with children from adults

Teens (PG-13).description: Content suitable for teenage social media users
prohibited: Dangerous challenges that could cause harm
restricted: Controversial opinions (allowed but may limit reach)

Adult (R).description: Mature content for adult social media users

violence.notes: Social media restricts graphic violence but allows news coverage. Violent threats taken seriously. Fight videos often removed.

profanity.notes: Generally permissive on most platforms. May affect algorithm visibility. Some profanity can trigger demonetization.

sexual_content.notes: Nudity policies vary - Instagram strict, Twitter permissive. Sexual content must be consensual and labeled. CSAM zero tolerance.

alcohol.notes: Allowed but advertising is regulated. Platforms may restrict alcohol ads to 21+. Excessive drinking content demonetized.

tobacco.notes: Tobacco ads prohibited. Organic tobacco content allowed but may affect monetization. Vaping content restricted on some platforms.

drugs.notes: Drug sales prohibited. Drug use content restricted. Cannabis complex - legal states allow more. Platforms may demonetize.

dangerous_activities.notes: Dangerous challenges, self-harm content, and stunts that could cause injury are restricted or removed. Suicide prevention resources required.

misinformation.notes: Medical and election misinformation actively moderated. COVID disinfo, vaccine misinfo, election fraud claims labeled or removed.

hate_speech.notes: All major platforms prohibit hate speech targeting protected characteristics (race, religion, gender, orientation, disability).

sponsorship.notes: FTC requires clear disclosure of paid partnerships, gifted products, and affiliate relationships. #ad or similar required.

platform_specific_rules.ftc_compliance: Paid partnerships must be disclosed clearly (FTC Endorsement Guidelines)
platform_specific_rules.coppa: No data collection from children under 13 without verifiable parental consent
platform_specific_rules.dmca: Respect copyright - infringing content will be removed
platform_specific_rules.section_230: Platforms can moderate as they see fit but have liability protections
platform_specific_rules.hashtag_policies: Avoid banned or restricted hashtags that limit visibility
